authors.name: J.K. Rowling
authors.note: British author, creator of the Harry Potter series, master of fantasy for all ages.

authors.name: George R.R. Martin
authors.note: American epic fantasy writer, known for complex plots and realistic characters.

authors.name: J.R.R. Tolkien
authors.note: British philologist and writer, creator of Middle-earth and a fantasy classic.

authors.name: Agatha Christie
authors.note: Queen of detective fiction, author of over 60 novels and numerous short stories.

authors.name: Stephen King
authors.note: American master of horror and thrillers, author of bestsellers.

authors.name: Jane Austen
authors.note: English novelist, known for sharp social commentary.

authors.name: Fyodor Dostoevsky
authors.note: Russian classic, exploring the depths of the human psyche.

authors.name: Gabriel García Márquez
authors.note: Colombian writer, master of magical realism.

authors.name: Ernest Hemingway
authors.note: American author, known for concise style and Nobel Prize winner.

authors.name: Toni Morrison
authors.note: American novelist, exploring the African American experience.

authors.name: Haruki Murakami
authors.note: Japanese author, blending surrealism and melancholy.

authors.name: Neil Gaiman
authors.note: British writer, master of fantasy and graphic novels.

authors.name: Virginia Woolf
authors.note: English modernist, pioneer of stream-of-consciousness.

authors.name: Leo Tolstoy
authors.note: Russian classic, author of epic novels about life and fate.

authors.name: Margaret Atwood
authors.note: Canadian writer, known for dystopian and feminist themes.

authors.name: Ray Bradbury
authors.note: American author of science fiction and fantasy.

authors.name: Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie
authors.note: Nigerian writer, exploring identity and culture.

authors.name: Isaac Asimov
authors.note: American sci-fi writer, creator of the laws of robotics.

authors.name: Dante Alighieri
authors.note: Italian poet, author of the epic 'Divine Comedy'.

authors.name: Ursula K. Le Guin
authors.note: American writer, master of fantasy and science fiction.

authors.name: Philip K. Dick
authors.note: American sci-fi author, exploring reality and consciousness.

authors.name: Mary Shelley
authors.note: English novelist, creator of the gothic novel 'Frankenstein'.

authors.name: Herman Melville
authors.note: American author, known for the novel 'Moby-Dick'.

authors.name: Zadie Smith
authors.note: British writer, exploring multiculturalism.

authors.name: Kazuo Ishiguro
authors.note: British-Japanese author, Nobel Prize winner.

authors.name: Salman Rushdie
authors.note: British-Indian writer, master of postcolonial literature.

authors.name: Charlotte Brontë
authors.note: English novelist, author of 'Jane Eyre'.

authors.name: Aldous Huxley
authors.note: British author, known for the dystopian 'Brave New World'.

authors.name: Octavia E. Butler
authors.note: American sci-fi writer, exploring race and gender.

authors.name: H.G. Wells
authors.note: British pioneer of science fiction.

books.title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
books.note: Fantasy about a young wizard, the start of a cult series.

books.title: A Game of Thrones
books.note: Epic fantasy about the struggle for power in Westeros.

books.title: The Hobbit
books.note: Adventure of hobbit Bilbo in the world of Middle-earth.

books.title: Murder on the Orient Express
books.note: Classic detective novel featuring Hercule Poirot.

books.title: The Shining
books.note: Horror about a writer in a haunted hotel.

books.title: Pride and Prejudice
books.note: Novel about love and social norms in the 19th century.

books.title: Crime and Punishment
books.note: Psychological novel about morality and guilt.

books.title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
books.note: Magical realism about the Buendía family.

books.title: The Old Man and the Sea
books.note: Novella about a man's struggle with nature.

books.title: Beloved
books.note: Story about the legacy of slavery in America.

books.title: Norwegian by Night
books.note: Surreal novel about memory and solitude.

books.title: American Gods
books.note: Fantasy about old and new gods in America.

books.title: Mrs Dalloway
books.note: Modernist novel about a day in Clarissa's life.

books.title: War and Peace
books.note: Epic novel about Russia in the Napoleonic era.

books.title: The Handmaid's Tale
books.note: Dystopia about a theocratic society.

books.title: Fahrenheit 451
books.note: Sci-fi about censorship and books.

books.title: Americanah
books.note: Novel about love, race, and immigration.

books.title: Foundation
books.note: Sci-fi about the future of humanity.

books.title: The Divine Comedy
books.note: Epic poem about a journey through Hell, Purgatory, and Paradise.

books.title: The Left Hand of Darkness
books.note: Sci-fi about gender and culture.

books.title: Do Androids Dream of Electric Sheep?
books.note: Sci-fi about the nature of humanity.

books.title: Frankenstein
books.note: Gothic novel about the creation of life.

books.title: Moby-Dick
books.note: Epic tale of revenge and nature.

books.title: White Teeth
books.note: Novel about multiculturalism in London.

books.title: Never Let Me Go
books.note: Dystopia about the fate of clones.
